field.label: JMS Version
field.helpText: Select the desired JMS Version the connector uses to connect to the service.

field.label: Server Type
field.helpText: Select the JMS Vendor. Use Generic JNDI when the desired Server Type is not listed among the options.

field.label: Use Authentication
field.helpText: Indicate whether authentication is required to establish the connection to the service or not.

field.label: Username
field.helpText: Enter your username to log into your service account.

field.label: Password
field.helpText: Enter your password to log into your service account.

field.label: Connection Factory JNDI Lookup
field.helpText: Enter the JNDI name of the connection factory.

field.label: Initial Context Factory
field.helpText: Enter the fully qualified class name of the factory class that creates the initial context.

field.label: Provider URL
field.helpText: Enter the the URL for the service provider.

field.label: JDBC URL
field.helpText: Enter the JDBC URL, which may differ depending on which JDBC driver you use. Refer to the JDBC vendor documentation for the connection URL syntax.

field.label: JMS Properties
field.helpText: Enter the custom configuration properties to be used when connecting to the service.

field.label: Host Name
field.helpText: Enter the name of the host where the queue manager is installed.

field.label: Connection Name List
field.helpText: Enter a comma-separated list containing the IP addresses and ports of active and standby queue managers. Use the following format: ip-address1(port1),ip-address(port2). For example: 127.0.0.1(5555),127.0.0.2(5555)

field.label: Port
field.helpText: Enter the port number used by the queue manager.

field.label: Queue Manager
field.helpText: Enter the name of the queue manager to connect to.

field.label: Channel
field.helpText: Enter the name of the WebSphere MQ channel used to connect to the queue manager.

field.label: Use SSL
field.helpText: Select to display a list of SSL cipher suites available for selection.

field.label: SSL Cipher Suite
field.helpText: Select the SSL cipher suite to use with this connection. If the desired SSL suite is not listed, select 'Custom SSL Cipher Suite' and enter its name in the field below.

field.label: Custom SSL Cipher Suite
field.helpText: Enter the name of the custom SSL cipher suite to use with this connection. This value is only take into consideration when selecting the option 'Custom SSL Cipher Suite'

field.label: Use Connection Pool
field.helpText: Select to enable connection pooling. This may increase performance by using resources more efficiently.

field.label: Pool Maximum Connections
field.helpText: Enter the maximum number of connections allowed in the pool at any time. Setting this value to 0 indicates an unbounded number of connections. You will receive an error if you attempt to exceed the maximum.

field.label: Pool Minimum Connections
field.helpText: Enter the minimum number of connections allowed in the pool at all times. This number must be less or equals to Pool Maximum Connections.

field.label: Pool Maximum Idle Time
field.helpText: Enter the length of time in seconds that a connection can remain open in an idle state.

field.label: Pool Maximum Wait Time
field.helpText: Enter the length of time in seconds to wait for a connection from the pool.

field.label: Pool Exhausted Action
field.helpText: Indicate whether to wait for a connection or immediately fail when a connection pool becomes exhausted.

field.label: Use Transactions
field.helpText: Enable/Disable Transactional mode.

field.label: Transaction Batch Size
field.helpText: Indicate the number of messages to be sent within a transaction batch.

field.label: Correlation ID
field.helpText: Indicate the correlation ID for the message.

field.label: Message Type
field.helpText: Indicate the message type.

field.label: Priority
field.helpText: Indicate the priority level for this message.

field.label: Reply To
field.helpText: Indicate the Destination object to which a reply to this message should be sent.

field.label: Time to live
field.helpText: Set the length of time in milliseconds from its dispatch time that a produced message should be retained by the message system. The value has to be greater or equal to zero. Zero indicates that the message does not expire.

field.label: Custom Properties
field.helpText: Indicate the properties values with their specified name into the message.

field.label: Filter
field.helpText: Use a filter to reduce the number of returned objects in the query. The filter does not support wildcard characters (* or ?). Queue names beginning with the specified string are returned.

field.label: Use Transactions
field.helpText: Enable/Disable Transactional mode.

field.label: Durable Subscription (only for Topics)
field.helpText: A durable subscription allows subscribers to receive all the messages published on a topic, including those published while the subscriber is inactive.

field.label: Subscription Name
field.helpText: The unique id with which durable subscription will be identified.

field.label: Receive Mode
field.helpText: Select the Receive Mode to specify how the connector fetches messages from JMS. Select No Wait for retrieving a single message already available in the destination. Select Limited Number of Messages to configure the number of messages the connector fetches before returning them. Select Limited Number of Messages with Timeout to configure the number of messages to be fetched and the number of milliseconds the connector waits before returning them. Select Unlimited Number of Messages with Timeout to configure the number of milliseconds the connector fetches messages before returning them.

allowedValue.label: Limited Number of Messages with Timeout
Unlimited Number of Messages with Timeout

field.label: Number of Messages
field.helpText: Indicate the number of messages to be retrieved by the connector

field.label: Maximum Number of Messages
field.helpText: Indicate the maximum number of messages the connector attempts to retrieve in the configured timeout

field.label: Receive Timeout
field.helpText: Indicate the timeout in milliseconds for the connector to retrieve messages

field.label: Filter
field.helpText: Use a filter to reduce the number of returned objects in the query. The filter does not support wildcard characters (* or ?). Queue names beginning with the specified string are returned.

field.label: Delivery Policy
field.helpText: Select the delivery policy to specify how to handle the receipt and acknowledgment of messages. Select «At least once» to acknowledge message receipt after successfully processing the messages. Select «At most once» to acknowledge message receipt before processing the messages.

field.label: Use Transactions
field.helpText: Enable/Disable Transactional mode.

field.label: Message Selector
field.helpText: Indicate the selector expression to filter the messages based on their properties.

field.label: Durable Subscription (only for Topics)
field.helpText: When «Durable Subscription» is enabled, the server returns every non expired message to the named subscription, including those published while the subscriber was inactive.

field.label: Subscription Name
field.helpText: The Unique ID with which «Durable Subscription» will be identified.

field.label: Maximum Concurrent Executions
field.helpText: Specify the maximum number of process executions that are allowed to run simultaneously in a single runtime container.

field.label: Singleton Listener
field.helpText: If selected, the Listen operation will start in a single node for multi-node runtimes, with only one instance of the singleton operation per container. When unchecked, the listener will be started in all available nodes by default.

field.label: Filter
field.helpText: Use a filter to reduce the number of returned objects in the query. The filter does not support wildcard characters (* or ?). Queue names beginning with the specified string are returned.
